metadata.name: Linux Shell Pipe to Shell
metadata.comment: Detects suspicious process command line that starts with a shell that executes something and finally gets piped into another shell

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (startswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('sh -c ')) OR startswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('bash -c '))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('| bash ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('| sh ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('|bash ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('|sh '))) AND (endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('| bash')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('| sh')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('|bash')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' |sh'))))

output.summary: Detects suspicious process command line that starts with a shell that executes something and finally gets piped into another shell

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate software that uses these patterns Reference: Internal Research
